definition: dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream

sentences.chinese: 只留下一个冰冷的梦境。

sentences.english: In the reality, it's gonna never happen.
sentences.chinese: 而今害怕那真实得无法挣脱的梦境。

sentences.english: Refugees from the realm of dreams whose minds are as sharp as their swords.
sentences.chinese: 梦境国度的逃难者，思想锋锐如利剑银刀。
一个斑驳又破碎的梦境。

sentences.english: Unconsciously and unintentionally we fill up the gaps and supplement the dream-images.
sentences.chinese: 我们会不自觉地填补梦境中未被忆起的空白。

sentences.english: This is my dream, dream of the belief of realization is.
sentences.chinese: 这是我的梦，是梦境实现的圣域。

sentences.english: This photo to me is about dreaming, Chiao said.
sentences.chinese: 焦立中说，这张照片中的美景对他而言就如同梦境。

sentences.english: Mix that fantasy dreamscape sketch with the steampunk idea.
sentences.chinese: 把那个神奇的梦境图和蒸气朋克揉在一起。

sentences.english: In the dream, I had wings and flied freely.
sentences.chinese: 在那个梦境中，我有双翅膀而且能随意飞翔。

sentences.english: Alternatively, they may simply ‘watch’ the dream unfold.
sentences.chinese: 或者，他们也许只是“静观”梦境的上演。

sentences.english: The scene takes place in a dream athmosphere where time seems to be suspended.
sentences.chinese: 事件发生的场景有如梦境，时间仿佛停止了。

sentences.english: In Chapter IX of the novel, Catherine implored Nelly to listen to her presentation of her dreamland.
sentences.chinese: 在小说第九章，凯瑟琳央求耐莉听她讲述自己的梦境。

sentences.english: Rinpoche also stressed the importance of carrying the mirror-mind into the dream and deep sleep states.
sentences.chinese: 仁波切地强调梦境与深睡状态中的明镜之心。

sentences.english: She trode with the feeling of one who walks in her sleep.
sentences.chinese: 她走着的那种感觉竟象在梦境中走路一般。

sentences.english: She said that dreams go by contraries.
sentences.chinese: 他说梦境预兆相反的事。

sentences.english: A streak of spring light is whitening the curtain, across my dream.
sentences.chinese: 一缕春光穿过梦境染白窗帘。

definition: dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子 dreams of a butterfly (or is it the butterfly dreaming of Zhuangzi?)
